website_summaries.verdict: While expensive, the well-built and supercomfortable Sony MDR-Z7 can go toe to toe with competing high-end audiophile headphones.
pros: The Sony MDR-Z7 is a well-crafted, very comfortable audiophile-grade headphone that features well-balanced, articulate sound
For a closed-back headphone, the soundstage is wide (it sounds more like an open-back headphone)
Two cables are included, one of which is designed for use with balanced audio headphone amps and players
cons: no protective carrying case or pouch

customer_reviews.title: A round of applause for SONY!
customer_reviews.text: I've never been a big fan of SONY headpones; to me they always lacked immediacy and punch... until now, that is. When I plugged these beauties into my CEntrance DACmini, I was honestly blown away! Can a headphone have powerful, in-your-gut bass and have extraordinary clarity and soundstage at the same time... YES, these have that. Welcome SONY to the realm of the audiophile headphone! They're right at the top of my collection (and I own the JVC DX1000i, KOSS ESP 950, and Sennheiser HD700 -- all of which I love for distinct reasons)
customer_reviews.author: Vannyc

customer_reviews.title: left side stopped working with very little use
customer_reviews.text: ugh. i've had these 2 years. they have sounded fantastic, but since i have other headphones these weren't used very much. maybe less than 200 hours total, and that may be generous. went to listen to them today, and the left side wasn't working. after a bunch of testing with the cable and sources, yep - it is the driver that stopped working. unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Shane_FDB

customer_reviews.title: Great headphones to own!
customer_reviews.text: I never came across a Sony headphone/iem that sounded bad and this is no exception. Only problem I had with this is the seal that was so tight my ears would start sweating and then I wished I could jump into cold water! That good the seal is with this thing. I bought this refurbished for a good price. Looked new but not in original packaging. Whole thing was wrapped in bubble wrap. The cable connectors were wrapped in styrofoam. Got a case to put the headphones as basically it was an expensive headphone at time of release ($699) Still not outdated in any form.
customer_reviews.author: 4EVERME

customer_reviews.title: Great sound and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I used to have a Grado 225 and those sounded great. This one is even better even though it is a closed back versus the open of the Grados. It is much more confrotable to wear for longer periods although it does (at first) look ridiculously large.
customer_reviews.author: EY3

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!! Worth every dollar.
customer_reviews.text: Works great with PHA3 amplifier. Great bass and it is well-balanced. I'm using the balanced cables. It is comfy on the ears even after hours of listening. I use it at Starbucks and work a lot. Works great. I have to say that the PHA3 is a great match. Max volume and no distortion. Great job Sony!
customer_reviews.author: Wisam Al-Rawi

customer_reviews.title: A reliable and dependable seller. I would buy from Kachin again.
customer_reviews.text: This Sony MDR Z7 was exactly as described by Kachan. It was like new and has a great sound. Kachin responded the same day to my questions. The shipment was expedited and a headphone case was gratuitously added. A 5 star for kachan.
customer_reviews.author: DMS

customer_reviews.title: A short take from an audiophile with over $250k+ gear...
customer_reviews.text: Most reviews are long, so tl;dr - I own over 100 pairs of headphones and IEM's (not counting speakers). While I usually hate Sony headphones (except the SA5000), this is a major exception. So for me to rate this 5-stars is saying a lot. If I had to name the best aspect, it'd be bass. Typical of high-end Sony's. If you want more details on the build quality or sound, read other reviews; I won't be redundant. BUY THESE WHILE THE SUPPLY IS STILL THERE. THEY WILL BE DISCONTINUED LIKE THE SA5000'S!!
customer_reviews.author: D. X.

customer_reviews.title: These are a great package. I use this pair with the portable ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a great package. I use this pair with the portable Sony Hi-Res amp USB'ed to my iphone or computer. Casual listening and movies when I can't use the home theater (guests visiting etc). Solid materials, no squeaks, deep rich bass and 'presence', very comfortable and cush-fit. I like craftsmanship and durable assembly. The price is eyebrow-worthy... but I feel I got what I paid for. This fits the bill... Very impressed
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: They are ridiculously well made and comfortable. They have paralyzing bass
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional cable builder. These are underpriced at $700 and nearly at the top of my list. They are ridiculously well made and comfortable. They have paralyzing bass. They are easy to drive. And they compete in the $1000-$2000 headphone segment with no obvious flaws. I own the most expensive headphones there are and this is already an early favorite.
customer_reviews.author: PB

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: AAAif you go into this you have to go completely, these are wonderful headphones, but if you want to get 100% you have to look at pha-3, truly this amp takes them to the extreme, and compared with x2 philips, JVC HA-FX850, sony mdr EX1000 and none are wing height of these z7, and clarify all these are maravillsos headphones, in short if you want the best sound over there have to be this couple (sony mdr-Z7 and sony pha-3)
customer_reviews.author: jose rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Broke one month after purchase. I lost receipt and ...
customer_reviews.text: Broke one month after purchase. I lost receipt and sony said can not fix it under warranty without receipt. Thank you Sony. 😟
customer_reviews.author: BLL

customer_reviews.title: Bad product. After a month and a half
customer_reviews.text: Bad product. After a month and a half, one side doesn't work; and Amazon tell me "This item is no longer eligible for return.". What can I do in this case. Much money away.
customer_reviews.author: Gio R. Varela

customer_reviews.title: Truly
customer_reviews.text: My use: pha-3, big honking balanced wire, and MDRZ7. This is close to a $2,000 setup, and I started with just the phone. Originally, the highs on the phone w/original wire, very much irritated me so I kept adapting the setup, and then I didn't come to terms with it until it was broke in. It has gradually become my go to with a good hifi source because this guy only truly shines on new standards. You don't truly hear it until you reach the hifi level, and then it will repay you and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Davenport

customer_reviews.title: Not just for mobile use.
customer_reviews.text: Amazingly light, perfectly comfortable. These have replaced my beloved Fostex planars for home use. Do them justice with a real amp (i.e. not a motherboard's "headphone amp") and you will find it hard to be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sintek

customer_reviews.title: Sony MDR-Z7......... Sony's Top- Of -The- Line  Audiophile Headphones
customer_reviews.text: This is my 1st pair of audiophile cans from Sony and I must say they are almost perfect. I currently own audiophile headphones from Audeze.Audio Technica AKG,Beyerdynamic,Grado, Hifiman and Sennheiser and I find the Sony MDR-Z7 outstanding in many ways. "Darker/warmer emphasized" than the AKG's/ Beyer's/Grado's. Bass well extended. Midrange is NOT recessed or overly forward, Treble Not harsh/bright. "Analogue sounding" ...SMOOTH and easily enjoyable for long listening sessions Overall build quality is superb. Made In Japan.Highly recommended in the $500-$700 price range.
customer_reviews.author: TheCanMan

customer_reviews.title: and good sounding. Of course
customer_reviews.text: If you're thinking about headphones, you owe it to yourself to try these. Extremely well made, and good sounding. Of course, it helps to have good source material, a good headphone amp, a good DAC, etc.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: A true bargain for an audiophile looking for a balance headphone with a punch.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a professional cable manufacture as well and I must say that the years in the business as finally paid off in a product that is well priced and has the making to become an audiophile target. Pair this in balance with PHA-3 portable headphone amp/dac and the combination is truly an experience. Thanks Sony for coming back to the "game".
customer_reviews.author: Craig Sanborn

customer_reviews.title: Not at all what I was expecting from Sony.
customer_reviews.text: These sound nothing like a higher end Sony MDRV6 or Sony MDR1R. The bass on these headphones is tuned in a ridiculous way. If you are looking for a more neutral sound then look elsewhere. I would rate both of the aforementioned Sony headphones higher than these. Any improved detail is completely ruined by the distorted bass. Per usual for Sony headphones these are fairly comfortable. Maybe a little too heavy for long sessions.
customer_reviews.author: E. Beranek

customer_reviews.title: Wow! SONY MDR-Z7 Stereo Headphones
customer_reviews.text: The SONY MDR-Z7 is a very good stereo headphone. They are the most comfortable headphones I have ever owned. The sound quality is much better than anything offered in the $100.00 range. You can hear percussion that other headphones miss completely! SONY makes this particular model with great care in Japan. They are really nice to look at as well. You will like these headphones. I know I do.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

product_meta.title: Sony MDRZ7 Hi-Res Stereo Headphones
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Standard PackagingSony MDR-Z7 headphones meld solid, thoughtfully designed aluminum structure with lush, ergonomic, enfolding comfort, and ultra-responsive audio performance for extended listening sessions bar-none.
feature_bullets: Wide Soundstage Reproduction up to 100 kHz, 70 mm driver units with ALCP for articulate audio reproduction, Balanced output capable for perfect signal separation and sound quality, 4-conductor cable for better signal separation and resulting sound quality

Ergonomic ear pads w/3D sewing afford ultra-comfort and powerful bass, Customize with optional cables engineered with Kimber Kable, Silver coated OFC cable minimizes signal transmission loss, Beat Response Control for improved bass and transient response

Enfolding structure for total, wrap-around feel and acoustic seal, Inward axis structure delivers optimum fit, Silent joints won't disturb your audio experience, Made in Japan. Cord type: Detachable Y-type

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars50 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
